The renin–angiotensin system (RAS), or renin–angiotensin–aldosterone system (RAAS), is a hormone system that regulates electrolyte balance, as well as systemic vascular resistance.
43– 45 A gradual increase in the different components of the RAS in pregnancy is a physiological condition for maternal–fetal circulation. The effects of the stimulated RAS in normal pregnancy are incompletely realized.
